Name: Direction Home Sangha

Name: Gentle Hearts Sangha
Description: This is an online Sangha with links to Stream Entering/ Nhap Luu Monastery in Victoria Australia. Following the Health Practitioners Retreat at Stream Entering Monastery in February 2023, several participants expressed the desire to remain connected in the community, so that we can support each other in our work and lives caring for others, drawing on the wisdom of Plum Village practices. Our aim is to inspire each other to practice based in the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. Join us and embrace a journey of resilience and shared wisdom, continuing your path with a community that values your dedication to helping others. Zoom link shared on the Facebook group.

Name: Happy Teachers Together Sangha
Description: For educators & other adults in the education ecosystem

Name: Indian – Ahimsa Trust Sanghas
Description: A practice community of mostly Indian friends with a number of regular online meetings. Please visit website for details.

Name: International Family Sangha

Name: Leeds Interbeing Sangha
Description: Studying 'The Art of Living' and other books by Thay

Name: Lotus Bud Sangha
Description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful. Each Thursday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

Name: Mindful Leadership Sangha
Description: We practice together and explore mindful leadership topics

Name: Morning Sun Sangha
Description: Morning Sun Sangha meets bi-weekly on Thursday. Starting times alternate month to month: 16:00 CET in November 2024, 17:00 CET in December 2024, 16:00 CET in January 2025, 17:00 February 2025.

Name: Mossy Path Sangha
Description: We practice for one hour on Sunday mornings with an up to 30 minute guided meditation, Touching the Earth, and a rotation of dharma sharing, sutra reading, tea ceremony, and 5 Mindfulness Trainings reading and discussion

Name: Neurodivergent Sangha
Description: Neurodivergent Sangha offers a safe and reliable space where you can express and liberate what you’ve been hiding without the fear of discrimination. Embracing neurodiversity through mindful connection, we provide spiritual support with Thich Nhat Hanh Tradition Plum Village's Practice. Our practices include Guided Meditation, Deep Listening, and Contemplative Exercise, helping you accept differences, build confidence, and achieve peace of mind. Join us to experience a community that values acceptance and spiritual growth.

Name: Red Kite Zen Sangha
Frequency: various days and times each month
Description: Red Kite Zen is a simple zen meditation and mindfulness group open to everyone - from beginners to more experienced - all are welcome - please visit our website for more info or to join our invite list

Name: Science Sangha
Description: A home for practitioners who work or have worked as researchers and teachers at universities, research institutes or elsewhere in a R&D environment

Name: Still Waters Sangha

Name: Total Relaxation & Healing Sangha
Description: For friends suffering high stress and anxiety

Name: Earth Holder Community Ireland
Description: The Earth Holder Community is a branch of the Plum Village tree that applies Thay’s core teachings on engaged Buddhism, mindful living, social and racial justice, and inter-being with Mother Earth at this time of ecological crisis. We practice with the aims of bringing mindfulness, compassion, healing and nonviolence to protecting ourselves, one another, all beings and the Earth. We meet online on the First Sunday of the month, as part of the Sangha na Saoirse, Sunday morning weekly meetings. Typical online EHCI gatherings includes a guided meditation, a reading or recording from Thay's teachings on earth holding and interbeing, walking mediation and dharma sharing. These gatherings are open to all. You are very welcome to join us from anywhere in the world.

Name: Compassionate Presence Mindful Community
Description: I was introduced to a local Plum Village tradition Sangha in 2009. After several years of practicing with that sangha I started the Compassionate Presence Mindful Community. We have both an online and in person gatherings. At both gatherings we practice the teachings of our dear Thay working to bring peace and reduce suffering through his teachings. Please see our website for details regarding times and dates of our gatherings plus general information about our practice.

Name: Living the 14 Sangha
Description: Living the 14 Sangha The 14 Mindfulness Trainings are the foundation of the Order of Interbeing and we are strengthening our commitment to them by looking deeply at a single training each week.  We are open to OI members, Aspirants and pre-Aspirants. Each week is a study in itself. You are welcome anytime, week to week. Wednesdays, 7:30-9 PM ET on zoom.

Name: Nanaimo Buddhist Meditation Group
Description: Established in 2003, we meet every Saturday at 10 am to 12 pm in Nanaimo BC, Canada. Due toCovid, we practice on Zoom (i.e. online) at this present time.

Name: Cedar Cabin Sangha
Description: Our sangha has practiced more than 20 years ago and continues weekly in downtown Ithaca, NY.   In 2002, we began our practice in the Plum Village tradition. Each week we come together in person in a friendly, welcoming gathering to share songs, guided meditations, walking meditation, readings, silent meditation, a tea ceremony and dharma sharing. We meet alternate weeks on Zoom + in person. All are welcome.

Name: Trusting Hearts Sangha
Description: We are a Valencia-based sangha, rooted in the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh and the Spirit Rock tradition of Vipassana. Gathering monthly, we come together to honor the Three Jewels: the Dharma, meditation, and the sangha. Each meeting offers a space for stillness, reflection, and connection, including Dharma sharing and the gift of deep listening. Sharing is always invited but never required. Our circle is open to all—come as you are, and be warmly welcomed.

Name: Breathe, You Are Alive
Description: We are a small sangha that meets weekly to practice sitting meditation followed by a few mindful movements, read a short text and share what’s in our hearts. We find that this regular practice brings us solidity and joy in our everyday lives. For more information please check our website.

UK-based, however we welcome people from anywhere.

Name: Sangha Slovenia
Description:
Smo Sangha Slovenija, sveže ustanovljena za prakso v tradiciji Plum Village.  Pozdravljeni,  dragi prijatelj!  

Rojstvo Sanghe v tradiciji Plum Village v Sloveniji poteka že nekaj časa.  Zdaj, ko nas je peščica ljudi, ki so pokazali zanimanje, bi se radi začeli občasno srečevati.  S tem v mislih predlagamo spletno srečanje, da se malo spoznamo in izmenjamo zamisli ter čas, oblike in pogostost takih srečanj. Srečanje bi bilo okvirno konec marca 2025. 

Če vas sodelovanje zanima, nam, prosimo, sporočite na npimentel0722@gmail.com. Poskusili bomo uskladiti čas spletnega srečanja tako, da bo vsem v redu. 

Z ljubečo prijaznostjo,

Sangha Slovenia

Name: Bulgarian Plum Village Sangha
Description: The Bulgarian Plum Village Sanga was established in 2021. We meet online and practice usually Guided Sitting Meditation (or Slow Walking, Deep Relaxation etc.), presentation of Plum Village Practice (text, Dharma talk or video) and Dharma Sharing. Sometimes we have online sessions with Plum Village monastics who offer us short Dharma Talks and/or Questions and Answers sessions.

Name: บ่มเพาะพลังแห่งรัก (Cultivate the Power of Love)

Name: 霽月共修團(線上) (Jiyue Sangha Online)
Heart of Yokohama, Tokyo, Kamakura Sangha
Description: We are a community of friends practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village since 2013. We offer online gatherings, including a monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, as well as monthly in-person meetings in Yokohama. All are welcome!  https://www.beloved-community.net/english/heart-of-tokyo-yokohama-kamakura-sangha-english/

Name: Heart of Yokohama, Tokyo, Kamakura Sangha
